text: Absent Taxa
A list (concatenated and separated) of taxa reported absent during the dwc:Event.

Absences can be reported at any taxonomic level. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
Abundance Cap
The reported maximum number of dwc:Organisms.

context: Label for Are Non-target Taxa Fully Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/areNonTargetTaxaFullyReported
text: Are Non-target Taxa Fully Reported

context: Comment for Are Non-target Taxa Fully Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/areNonTargetTaxaFullyReported
text: Every dwc:Organism that was outside of the target taxonomic scope (the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope) and detected during the dwc:Event, and that was detectable using the given protocol (given in eco:protocolDescriptions and dwc:samplingProtocol), was reported.

context: Description for Are Non-target Taxa Fully Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/areNonTargetTaxaFullyReported
text: This term is meant to inform a user of the data whether there were non-target taxa that were detected, but left unreported. This term is only relevant if the dwc:Event used restricted search or open search methods and if a target taxonomic scope is declared. Taxonomic scope is based on the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope. Within dwc:Events that used either a restricted search or an open search method and declared a taxonomic scope, if all dwc:Organisms that are not included within the target taxonomic scope and that were detected during the dwc:Event were reported, the value of this term should be 'true', otherwise the value of this term should be ‘false'.
Compilation Source Types
The types of data sources contributing to the compilation reported.

This term is only relevant if the dwc:Event is a compilation in which one or more types of data sources were used. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
Compilation Types
A statement specifying whether data reported are derived from sampling events, ancillary data compiled from other sources, or a combination of both.

This term is only relevant if the dwc:Event is an inventory. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
Event Duration Unit
The units associated with the eco:eventDurationValue.

Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
Event Duration Value
The numeric value for the duration of the dwc:Event.
An eco:eventDurationValue must have a corresponding eco:eventDurationUnit.

context: Label for Excluded Degree of Establishment Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/excludedDegreeOfEstablishmentScope
text: Excluded Degree of Establishment Scope

context: Comment for Excluded Degree of Establishment Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/excludedDegreeOfEstablishmentScope
text: The degrees of establishment of the dwc:Organisms explicitly excluded from sampling during the dwc:Event.

context: Description for Excluded Degree of Establishment Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/excludedDegreeOfEstablishmentScope
text: Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the controlled vocabulary (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwcdoe/) for dwc:degreeOfEstablishment. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

context: Label for Excluded Growth Form Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/excludedGrowthFormScope
text: Excluded Growth Form Scope

context: Comment for Excluded Growth Form Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/excludedGrowthFormScope
text: The growth forms or habits of the dwc:Organisms explicitly excluded from sampling during the dwc:Event.

context: Description for Excluded Growth Form Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/excludedGrowthFormScope
text: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
Excluded Habitat Scope
The habitats explicitly excluded from sampling during the dwc:Event.

Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

context: Label for Excluded Life Stage Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/excludedLifeStageScope
text: Excluded Life Stage Scope

context: Comment for Excluded Life Stage Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/excludedLifeStageScope
text: The age classes or life stages of the dwc:Organisms explicitly excluded from sampling during the dwc:Event.

context: Description for Excluded Life Stage Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/excludedLifeStageScope
text: This term is defined based on dwc:lifeStage (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/lifeStage). Recommended best practice is to use the same controlled vocabulary as for dwc:lifeStage and to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
Excluded Taxonomic Scope
The taxonomic group(s) explicitly excluded from sampling during the dwc:Event.

The dwc:Event to which the eco:excludedTaxonomicScope refers could be at any level of hierarchy. In the case of a higher level (parent) dwc:Event, include all the taxonomic groups explicitly excluded from the child dwc:Events that contributed to the parent dwc:Event. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

context: Label for Geospatial Scope Area Unit http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/geospatialScopeAreaUnit
text: Geospatial Scope Area Unit

context: Comment for Geospatial Scope Area Unit http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/geospatialScopeAreaUnit
text: The units associated with eco:geospatialScopeAreaValue

context: Description for Geospatial Scope Area Unit http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/geospatialScopeAreaUnit
text: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. For units containing exponents, use characters from the Unicode Latin-1 Supplement character set (hex 00B2 for squared and 00B3 for cubed). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

context: Label for Geospatial Scope Area Value http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/geospatialScopeAreaValue
text: Geospatial Scope Area Value

context: Comment for Geospatial Scope Area Value http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/geospatialScopeAreaValue
text: The numeric value for the total area of the geospatial scope of the dwc:Event.

context: Description for Geospatial Scope Area Value http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/geospatialScopeAreaValue
text: Geospatial scope refers to the dwc:Event location reported using the terms organized in Darwin Core under dcterms:Location. This area is always greater than or equal to the eco:totalAreaSampledValue. An eco:geospatialScopeAreaValue must have a corresponding eco:geospatialScopeAreaUnit.
Has Material Samples
Material samples were collected during the dwc:Event.
Has Non-target Organisms

One or more dwc:Organisms outside the target organismal scopes (eco:targetDegreeOfEstablishmentScope, eco:targetGrowthFormScope, and eco:targetLifeStageScope) were detected and reported for this dwc:Event.

This term is meant to alert users to the presence of non-target organisms (in some disciplines called “bycatch”) reported in this dwc:Event. This term is relevant only if a target organismal scope is declared. Organismal scope is based on the combination of all of the following terms: eco:targetLifeStageScope, eco:excludedLifeStageScope, eco:targetDegreeOfEstablishmentScope, eco:excludedDegreeOfEstablishmentScope, eco:targetGrowthFormScope, and eco:excludedGrowthFormScope. Examination of the organismal scope is needed in order to identify the non-target dwc:Organisms. It should be possible to confirm the expectations by investigating the dwc:Occurrences in this dwc:Event and in its child dwc:Events (if available). The value of this term should be 'true' if dwc:Occurrences of dwc:Organisms outside the organismal scope(s) as defined at the time of the dwc:Event are reported, otherwise the value of this term should be 'false'.
Has Non-target Taxa
One or more dwc:Organisms of taxa outside the target taxonomic scope (the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope) were detected and reported for this dwc:Event.

This term is meant to alert users to the presence of non-target taxa (in some disciplines called “bycatch”) reported in this dwc:Event. This term is relevant only if a target taxonomic scope is declared. Taxonomic scope is based on the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope. Examination of the taxonomic scope is needed in order to identify the non-target taxa. It should be possible to confirm the expectations by investigating the dwc:Occurrences in this dwc:Event and in its child dwc:Events (if available) or by exploring eco:nonTargetTaxa for this dwc:Event (if populated). The value of this term should be 'true' if dwc:Occurrences of taxa outside the taxonomic scope as defined at the time of the dwc:Event are reported, otherwise the value of this term should be 'false'.
Has Vouchers
Specimen vouchers were collected during the dwc:Event.
Inventory Types
The types of search processes used to conduct the inventory.

This term is only relevant if the dwc:Event represents an inventory. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
Is Absence Reported
Taxonomic absences were reported.
Absences can be reported at any taxonomic level.

context: Label for Is Abundance Cap Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isAbundanceCapReported
text: Is Abundance Cap Reported

context: Comment for Is Abundance Cap Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isAbundanceCapReported
text: A maximum number of dwc:Organisms was reported, as specified or restricted by the protocol used.

context: Description for Is Abundance Cap Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isAbundanceCapReported
text: Values of abundance cap should be captured under the term eco:abundanceCap.
Is Abundance Reported
The number of dwc:Organisms collected or observed was reported.
Typically the abundance values would be reported in the dwc:organismQuantity and dwc:organismQuantityType terms for the child dwc:Occurrence records for this dwc:Event.

context: Label for Is Degree of Establishment Scope Fully Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isDegreeOfEstablishmentScopeFullyReported
text: Is Degree of Establishment Scope Fully Reported

context: Comment for Is Degree of Establishment Scope Fully Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isDegreeOfEstablishmentScopeFullyReported
text: Every dwc:Organism that was included within the degree of establishment scope, and was detected during the dwc:Event, was reported.

context: Description for Is Degree of Establishment Scope Fully Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isDegreeOfEstablishmentScopeFullyReported
text: This term is only relevant if the dwc:Event used restricted search or open search methods. If all dwc:Organisms included within the degree of establishment scope and detected during the dwc:Event were reported, the value should be 'true'. Degree of establishment scope is based on the combination of eco:targetDegreeOfEstablishmentScope and eco:excludedDegreeOfEstablishmentScope.

context: Label for Is Growth Form Scope Fully Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isGrowthFormScopeFullyReported
text: Is Growth Form Scope Fully Reported

context: Comment for Is Growth Form Scope Fully Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isGrowthFormScopeFullyReported
text: Every dwc:Organism that was included within the growth form scope, and was detected during the dwc:Event, was reported.

context: Description for Is Growth Form Scope Fully Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isGrowthFormScopeFullyReported
text: This term is only relevant if the dwc:Event used restricted search or open search methods. If all dwc:Organisms included within the growth form scope and detected during the dwc:Event were reported, the value should be 'true'. Growth form scope is based on the combination of eco:targetGrowthFormScope and eco:excludedGrowthFormScope.

context: Label for Is Least Specific Target Category Quantity Inclusive http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isLeastSpecificTargetCategoryQuantityInclusive
text: Is Least Specific Target Category Quantity Inclusive

context: Comment for Is Least Specific Target Category Quantity Inclusive http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isLeastSpecificTargetCategoryQuantityInclusive
text: The total detected quantity for a dwc:Taxon (including subcategories thereof) in a dwc:Event is given explicitly in a single record (dwc:organismQuantity value) for that dwc:Taxon.

context: Description for Is Least Specific Target Category Quantity Inclusive http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isLeastSpecificTargetCategoryQuantityInclusive
text: Recommended values are 'true' and 'false'. This term is only relevant if dwc:organismQuantity is a number. For a detailed explanation, see http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/doc/inclusive/.

context: Label for Is Life Stage Scope Fully Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isLifeStageScopeFullyReported
text: Is Life Stage Scope Fully Reported

context: Comment for Is Life Stage Scope Fully Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isLifeStageScopeFullyReported
text: Every dwc:Organism that was included within the life stage scope, and was detected during the dwc:Event, was reported.

context: Description for Is Life Stage Scope Fully Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isLifeStageScopeFullyReported
text: This term is only relevant if the dwc:Event used restricted search or open search methods. If all dwc:Organisms included within the life stage scope and detected during the dwc:Event were reported, the value should be 'true'. Life stage scope is based on the combination of eco:targetLifeStageScope and eco:excludedLifeStageScope.

context: Label for Is Sampling Effort Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isSamplingEffortReported
text: Is Sampling Effort Reported

context: Comment for Is Sampling Effort Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isSamplingEffortReported
text: The sampling effort associated with the dwc:Event was reported.

context: Description for Is Sampling Effort Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isSamplingEffortReported
text: Typically values of effort would be captured under the terms eco:samplingEffortValue and eco:samplingEffortUnit.

context: Label for Is Taxonomic Scope Fully Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isTaxonomicScopeFullyReported
text: Is Taxonomic Scope Fully Reported

context: Comment for Is Taxonomic Scope Fully Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isTaxonomicScopeFullyReported
text: Every dwc:Organism that was included within the taxonomic scope, and was detected during the dwc:Event, was reported.

context: Description for Is Taxonomic Scope Fully Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isTaxonomicScopeFullyReported
text: This term is only relevant if the dwc:Event used restricted search or open search methods. If all dwc:Organisms included within the taxonomic scope and detected during the dwc:Event were reported, the value should be 'true'. Taxonomic scope is based on the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope.

context: Label for Is Vegetation Cover Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isVegetationCoverReported
text: Is Vegetation Cover Reported

context: Comment for Is Vegetation Cover Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isVegetationCoverReported
text: A vegetation cover metric was reported.

context: Description for Is Vegetation Cover Reported http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/isVegetationCoverReported
text: Typically values or descriptions of vegetation cover would be captured under the term eco:verbatimSiteDescriptions.
Material Sample Types
A list (concatenated and separated) of material sample types collected during the dwc:Event.

Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
Non-target Taxa
A list (concatenated and separated) of taxa reported during the dwc:Event that are outside of the target taxonomic scope (the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope).

This term is meant to allow the full list of taxa that are considered outside of the taxonomic scope and yet were reported in the dataset to be shared. This term is relevant only if a target taxonomic scope is declared and eco:hasNonTargetTaxa is ‘true’. Taxonomic scope is based on the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope. Non-target taxa (in some disciplines called “bycatch”) can be reported at any taxonomic level. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
Protocol Descriptions
A detailed description of the methods used during the dwc:Event.

This description should be associated with protocols provided in eco:protocolNames. The description may include deviations from a protocol referred to in eco:protocolReferences. Recommended good practice is to provide information about instruments used, calibration, etc. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
Protocol Names
Categorical descriptive names for the methods used during the dwc:Event.

Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
Protocol References
The references to the methods used during the dwc:Event.
Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
Reported Extreme Conditions
A description of any extreme weather or environmental conditions that may have affected the dwc:Event.
Reported Weather
A list of weather or climatic conditions present during the dwc:Event.
Recommended best practice is to use a key:value encoding schema for a data interchange format such as JSON.
Sampling Effort Protocol
A description of or reference (publication or URL) to the methods used to determine the sampling effort.

This description should be associated with the values reported in eco:samplingEffortValue and eco:samplingEffortUnit. This is a specialization of eco:protocolDescriptions focused on effort, distinct from the survey method. The effort relates to the intensity of sampling and therefore can assist in interpreting estimates of completeness. This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
Sampling Effort Unit
The units associated with the eco:samplingEffortValue.

Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
Sampling Effort Value
The numeric value for the sampling effort expended during the dwc:Event.

This term is meant to capture the total sampling effort value. To express details of how the effort was determined use eco:samplingEffortProtocol. For compilations it is recommend not to infer effort. An eco:samplingEffortValue must have a corresponding eco:samplingEffortUnit.
Sampling Performed By
A person, group, or organization responsible for recording the dwc:Event.

The sampling dwc:Event could be at any level of hierarchy. In the case of a higher level (parent) dwc:Event, include all the organizations or people involved in the child dwc:Events that contributed to the parent dwc:Event. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
Site Count
Total number of individual sites surveyed during the dwc:Event.
Site refers to the location at which observations are made or samples/measurements are taken. The site can be at any level of hierarchy.
Site Nesting Description
Textual description of the hierarchical sampling design.
Site refers to the location at which observations are made or samples/measurements are taken. The site can be at any level of hierarchy.

context: Label for Target Degree of Establishment Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/targetDegreeOfEstablishmentScope
text: Target Degree of Establishment Scope

context: Comment for Target Degree of Establishment Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/targetDegreeOfEstablishmentScope
text: The degrees of establishment of the dwc:Organisms targeted for sampling during the dwc:Event.

context: Description for Target Degree of Establishment Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/targetDegreeOfEstablishmentScope
text: Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the controlled vocabulary (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwcdoe/) for dwc:degreeOfEstablishment. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

context: Label for Target Growth Form Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/targetGrowthFormScope
text: Target Growth Form Scope

context: Comment for Target Growth Form Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/targetGrowthFormScope
text: The growth forms or habits of the dwc:Organisms targeted for sampling during the dwc:Event.

context: Description for Target Growth Form Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/targetGrowthFormScope
text: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
Target Habitat Scope
The habitats targeted for sampling during the dwc:Event.

Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

context: Label for Target Life Stage Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/targetLifeStageScope
text: Target Life Stage Scope

context: Comment for Target Life Stage Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/targetLifeStageScope
text: The age classes or life stages of the dwc:Organisms targeted for sampling during the dwc:Event.

context: Description for Target Life Stage Scope http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/targetLifeStageScope
text: This term is defined based on dwc:lifeStage (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/lifeStage). Recommended best practice is to use the same controlled vocabulary as for dwc:lifeStage and to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
Target Taxonomic Scope
The taxonomic group(s) targeted for sampling during the dwc:Event.

The dwc:Event to which the eco:targetTaxonomicScope refers could be at any level of hierarchy. In the case of a higher level (parent) dwc:Event, include all taxonomic groups surveyed in the child dwc:Events that contributed to the parent dwc:Event. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
Taxon Completeness Protocols
A description of or reference (publication, URL) to the methods used to determine eco:taxonCompletenessReported.

This term allows users to determine how comprehensively an area has been sampled. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
Taxon Completeness Reported
Statement about whether the taxonomic completeness of the dwc:Event was assessed.

This term is meant to alert users that the inventory was conducted in such a way that all of the target taxa (the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope) should have been detectable if they were present during the dwc:Event. This term can provide data users with a qualitative measure of how comprehensively an area has been surveyed, which assists in interpreting species populations, areas of occupancy, inferring species absences, etc. This term is only relevant if the dwc:Event used restricted search or open search methods. If taxonomic completeness was assessed, the methods used or an explanation of the basis of the completeness should be stated in eco:taxonCompletenessProtocols. Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the controlled vocabulary designated for use with this term, listed at http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/doc/tcr/. This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

context: Label for Total Area Sampled Unit http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/totalAreaSampledUnit
text: Total Area Sampled Unit

context: Comment for Total Area Sampled Unit http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/totalAreaSampledUnit
text: The units associated with eco:totalAreaSampledValue

context: Description for Total Area Sampled Unit http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/totalAreaSampledUnit
text: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. For units containing exponents, use characters from the Unicode Latin-1 Supplement character set (hex 00B2 for squared and 00B3 for cubed). This term has an equivalent in the ecoiri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

context: Label for Total Area Sampled Value http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/totalAreaSampledValue
text: Total Area Sampled Value

context: Comment for Total Area Sampled Value http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/totalAreaSampledValue
text: The numeric value for the total area surveyed during the dwc:Event.

context: Description for Total Area Sampled Value http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/totalAreaSampledValue
text: This area is always less than or equal to the eco:geospatialScopeAreaValue. An eco:totalAreaSampledValue must have a corresponding eco:totalAreaSampledUnit.
Verbatim Site Descriptions
Original textual description of the site(s).

Site refers to the location at which observations are made or samples/measurements are taken. The site can be at any level of hierarchy. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
Verbatim Site Names
A list (concatenated and separated) of original site names.

Site refers to the location at which observations are made or samples/measurements are taken. The site can be at any level of hierarchy. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
Verbatim Target Scope
The verbatim original description of the dwc:Event scope.

Recommended best practice is first to populate explicit scope terms to the fullest extent possible (e.g., eco:targetTaxonomicScope). It is not recommended to use this term in assessing absence or completeness.
Voucher Institutions
A list (concatenated and separated) of the names or acronyms of the institutions where vouchers collected during the dwc:Event were deposited.
Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
